			<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en">Israel</h1>

				<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><div role="note" class="hatnote">This article is about the modern country. For other uses, see <a href="/wiki/Israel_(disambiguation)" class="mw-disambig" title="Israel (disambiguation)">Israel (disambiguation)</a>.</div>

<li value="1"><span class="citation wikicite" id="endnote_area"><b><a href="#ref_area">^</a></b></span> 20,770 is Israel within the <a href="/wiki/Green_Line_(Israel)" title="Green Line (Israel)">Green Line</a>. 22,072 includes the <a href="/wiki/Annexed" class="mw-redirect" title="Annexed">annexed</a> <a href="/wiki/Golan_Heights" title="Golan Heights">Golan Heights</a> and <a href="/wiki/East_Jerusalem" title="East Jerusalem">East Jerusalem</a>.</li>

<table role="presentation" class="metadata mbox-small noprint selfref" style="background-color:#f9f9f9;border:1px solid #aaa;color:#000;width: 22em;">
<tr>
<td style="width:1px"></td>
<td class="mbox-text plainlist" style="vertical-align:middle; font-size:95%;"><b>This article contains <a href="/wiki/Hebrew_alphabet" title="Hebrew alphabet">Hebrew</a> and <a href="/wiki/Arabic_alphabet" title="Arabic alphabet">Arabic</a> text.</b> Without proper <a href="/wiki/Help:Multilingual_support" title="Help:Multilingual support">rendering support</a>, you may see <a href="/wiki/Replacement_character" class="mw-redirect" title="Replacement character">question marks, boxes, or other symbols</a>.</td>
</tr>
</table>
<p><b>Israel</b> (<span class="nowrap"><span class="IPA nopopups"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA_for_English" title="Help:IPA for English">/<span style="border-bottom:1px dotted"><span title="/ˈ/ primary stress follows">ˈ</span><span title="/ɪ/ short 'i' in 'bid'">ɪ</span><span title="'z' in 'zoom'">z</span><span title="'r' in 'rye'">r</span><span title="/eɪ/ long 'a' in 'base'">eɪ</span><span title="/əl/ 'le' in 'bottle'">əl</span></span>/</a></span></span>; <a href="/wiki/Hebrew_language" title="Hebrew language">Hebrew</a>: <span class="script-hebrew" style="font-size: 115%; font-family: Alef, 'SBL BibLit', 'SBL Hebrew', 'David CLM', 'Frenk Ruehl CLM', 'Hadasim CLM', Cardo, Shofar, David, 'Ezra SIL', 'Ezra SIL SR', 'Noto Sans Hebrew', FreeSerif, 'Times New Roman', FreeSans, Arial;" dir="rtl">יִשְׂרָאֵל</span>‎ <span title="Hebrew transliteration" class="Unicode" style="white-space:normal; text-decoration: none"><i>Yisrā'el</i></span>; <a href="/wiki/Arabic_language" class="mw-redirect" title="Arabic language">Arabic</a>: <span lang="ar" dir="rtl">إِسْرَائِيل</span>‎‎ <span title="ar ALA-LC transliteration" class="Unicode" style="white-space:normal; text-decoration: none"><i>Isrāʼīl</i></span>), officially the <b>State of Israel</b> (<a href="/wiki/Hebrew_language" title="Hebrew language">Hebrew</a>: <span class="script-hebrew" style="font-size: 115%; font-family: Alef, 'SBL BibLit', 'SBL Hebrew', 'David CLM', 'Frenk Ruehl CLM', 'Hadasim CLM', Cardo, Shofar, David, 'Ezra SIL', 'Ezra SIL SR', 'Noto Sans Hebrew', FreeSerif, 'Times New Roman', FreeSans, Arial;" dir="rtl">מְדִינַת יִשְׂרָאֵל</span>‎ <span class="unicode haudio"><span class="fn"><span style="white-space:nowrap"><a href="/wiki/File:He-Medinat_Israel2.ogg" title="About this sound"><img alt="About this sound" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/11px-Loudspeaker.svg.png" width="11" height="11" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/17px-Loudspeaker.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/22px-Loudspeaker.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="20" data-file-height="20" /></a>&#160;</span><a href="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/2/2b/He-Medinat_Israel2.ogg" class="internal" title="He-Medinat Israel2.ogg"><span title="Hebrew transliteration" class="Unicode" style="white-space:normal; text-decoration: none"><i>Medīnat Yisrā'el</i></span></a></span></span> <span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA_for_Hebrew" title="Help:IPA for Hebrew">[mediˈnat jisʁaˈʔel]</a></span>; <a href="/wiki/Arabic_language" class="mw-redirect" title="Arabic language">Arabic</a>: <span lang="ar" dir="rtl">دَوْلَة إِسْرَائِيل</span>‎‎ <span title="ar ALA-LC transliteration" class="Unicode" style="white-space:normal; text-decoration: none"><i>Dawlat Isrāʼīl</i></span> <span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA_for_Arabic" title="Help:IPA for Arabic">[dawlat ʔisraːˈʔiːl]</a></span>), is a country in the <a href="/wiki/Middle_East" title="Middle East">Middle East</a>, on the <a href="/wiki/Eastern_Mediterranean" title="Eastern Mediterranean">southeastern shore</a> of the <a href="/wiki/Mediterranean_Sea" title="Mediterranean Sea">Mediterranean Sea</a> and the northern shore of the <a href="/wiki/Red_Sea" title="Red Sea">Red Sea</a>. It has land <a href="/wiki/Borders_of_Israel" title="Borders of Israel">borders</a> with <a href="/wiki/Lebanon" title="Lebanon">Lebanon</a> to the north, <a href="/wiki/Syria" title="Syria">Syria</a> to the northeast, <a href="/wiki/Jordan" title="Jordan">Jordan</a> on the east, the <a href="/wiki/Palestinian_territories" title="Palestinian territories">Palestinian territories</a> of the <a href="/wiki/West_Bank" title="West Bank">West Bank</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gaza_Strip" title="Gaza Strip">Gaza Strip</a><sup id="cite_ref-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8">[8]</a></sup> to the east and west, respectively, and <a href="/wiki/Egypt" title="Egypt">Egypt</a> to the southwest. The country contains geographically diverse features within its relatively small <a href="/wiki/Geography_of_Israel" title="Geography of Israel">area</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-cia_2-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cia-2">[2]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9">[9]</a></sup> Israel's <a href="/wiki/Economy_of_Israel" title="Economy of Israel">economy</a> and <a href="/wiki/Science_and_technology_in_Israel" title="Science and technology in Israel">technology</a> center is <a href="/wiki/Tel_Aviv" title="Tel Aviv">Tel Aviv</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-lboro.ac.uk_10-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-lboro.ac.uk-10">[10]</a></sup> while its <a href="/wiki/Seat_of_government" title="Seat of government">seat of government</a> and proclaimed capital is <a href="/wiki/Jerusalem" title="Jerusalem">Jerusalem</a>, although the state's sovereignty over Jerusalem is <a href="/wiki/Positions_on_Jerusalem" title="Positions on Jerusalem">internationally unrecognized</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-11">[note 1]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-12">[11]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Jerusalem_Law_13-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Jerusalem_Law-13">[12]</a></sup></p>
<p>On 29 November 1947, the <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_General_Assembly" title="United Nations General Assembly">United Nations General Assembly</a> adopted a <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_Partition_Plan_for_Palestine" title="United Nations Partition Plan for Palestine">Partition Plan</a> for <a href="/wiki/Mandatory_Palestine" title="Mandatory Palestine">Mandatory Palestine</a>. This specified borders for new Arab and Jewish states and an area of <a href="/wiki/Corpus_separatum_(Jerusalem)" title="Corpus separatum (Jerusalem)">Jerusalem</a> which was to be administered by the UN under an international regime.<sup id="cite_ref-14" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-14">[13]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Harris_15-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Harris-15">[14]</a></sup> The end of the <a href="/wiki/British_Mandate_for_Palestine_(legal_instrument)" title="British Mandate for Palestine (legal instrument)">British Mandate for Palestine</a> was set for midnight on 14 May 1948. That day, <a href="/wiki/David_Ben-Gurion" title="David Ben-Gurion">David Ben-Gurion</a>, the executive head of the <a href="/wiki/World_Zionist_Organization" title="World Zionist Organization">Zionist Organization</a> and president of the <a href="/wiki/Jewish_Agency_for_Israel" title="Jewish Agency for Israel">Jewish Agency for Palestine</a>, <a href="/wiki/Israeli_Declaration_of_Independence" title="Israeli Declaration of Independence">declared</a> "the establishment of a <a href="/wiki/Jewish_state" title="Jewish state">Jewish state</a> in <a href="/wiki/Land_of_Israel" title="Land of Israel">Eretz Israel</a>, to be known as the State of Israel", which would start to function from the termination of the mandate.<sup id="cite_ref-16" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-16">[15]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-17" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-17">[16]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-18" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-18">[17]</a></sup> The borders of the new state were not specified in the declaration.<sup id="cite_ref-Harris_15-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Harris-15">[14]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-19" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-19">[18]</a></sup> Neighboring Arab armies <a href="/wiki/1948_Arab%E2%80%93Israeli_War" title="1948 Arab–Israeli War">invaded</a> the former British mandate on the next day and fought the Israeli forces.<sup id="cite_ref-20" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20">[19]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-21" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-21">[20]</a></sup> Israel has since fought <a href="/wiki/Arab%E2%80%93Israeli_conflict" title="Arab–Israeli conflict">several wars</a> with neighboring Arab states,<sup id="cite_ref-RoutledgeAtlas_22-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-RoutledgeAtlas-22">[21]</a></sup> in the course of which it has <a href="/wiki/Israeli-occupied_territories" title="Israeli-occupied territories">occupied</a> the West Bank, <a href="/wiki/Sinai_Peninsula" title="Sinai Peninsula">Sinai Peninsula</a> (1956–57, 1967–82), part of <a href="/wiki/Southern_Lebanon" title="Southern Lebanon">Southern Lebanon</a> (1982–2000), Gaza Strip (1967–2005; still considered occupied after <a href="/wiki/Israeli_disengagement_from_Gaza" title="Israeli disengagement from Gaza">2005 disengagement</a>)<sup id="cite_ref-note2_23-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-note2-23">[note 2]</a></sup> and the <a href="/wiki/Golan_Heights" title="Golan Heights">Golan Heights</a>. It extended its laws to the Golan Heights and <a href="/wiki/East_Jerusalem" title="East Jerusalem">East Jerusalem</a>, but not the West Bank.<sup id="cite_ref-24" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-24">[22]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Olmertquote_25-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Olmertquote-25">[23]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-HomelandSecurityBorders_26-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HomelandSecurityBorders-26">[24]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-TelAvivNotes_27-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-TelAvivNotes-27">[25]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Israeli%E2%80%93Palestinian_peace_process" title="Israeli–Palestinian peace process">Efforts</a> to resolve the <a href="/wiki/Israeli%E2%80%93Palestinian_conflict" title="Israeli–Palestinian conflict">Israeli–Palestinian conflict</a> have not resulted in peace. However, peace treaties between Israel and both <a href="/wiki/Egypt%E2%80%93Israel_Peace_Treaty" title="Egypt–Israel Peace Treaty">Egypt</a> and <a href="/wiki/Israel%E2%80%93Jordan_peace_treaty" title="Israel–Jordan peace treaty">Jordan</a> have successfully been signed. Israel's occupation of the Palestinian territories is the world's <a href="/wiki/List_of_military_occupations" title="List of military occupations">longest military occupation</a> in modern times.<sup id="cite_ref-note2_23-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-note2-23">[note 2]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-29" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-29">[27]</a></sup></p>
<p>The <a href="/wiki/Demographics_of_Israel" title="Demographics of Israel">population of Israel</a>, as defined by the <a href="/wiki/Israel_Central_Bureau_of_Statistics" title="Israel Central Bureau of Statistics">Israel Central Bureau of Statistics</a>, was estimated in 2017 to be 8,661,790&#160;people.<sup id="cite_ref-cbs_main_3-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-cbs_main-3">[3]</a></sup> It is the world's only <a href="/wiki/Jewish_population_by_country" title="Jewish population by country">Jewish-majority state</a>, with 74.8% being designated as <a href="/wiki/Israeli_Jews" title="Israeli Jews">Jewish</a>. The country's second largest group of citizens are <a href="/wiki/Arab_citizens_of_Israel" title="Arab citizens of Israel">Arabs</a>, at 20.8% (including the Druze and most East Jerusalem Arabs).<sup id="cite_ref-population_stat_1-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-population_stat-1">[1]</a></sup> The great majority of Israeli Arabs are Sunni <a href="/wiki/Islam_in_Israel" title="Islam in Israel">Muslims</a>, including significant numbers of <a href="/wiki/Sedentism" title="Sedentism">semi-settled</a> <a href="/wiki/Negev_Bedouin" title="Negev Bedouin">Negev Bedouins</a>; the rest are <a href="/wiki/Christianity_in_Israel" title="Christianity in Israel">Christians</a> and <a href="/wiki/Druze_in_Israel" title="Druze in Israel">Druze</a>. Other minorities include <a href="/wiki/Arameans_in_Israel" title="Arameans in Israel">Arameans</a>, <a href="/wiki/Armenians_in_Israel" title="Armenians in Israel">Armenians</a>, <a href="/wiki/Assyrians_in_Israel" title="Assyrians in Israel">Assyrians</a>, <a href="/wiki/African_Hebrew_Israelites_of_Jerusalem" title="African Hebrew Israelites of Jerusalem">Black Hebrew Israelites</a>, <a href="/wiki/Circassians_in_Israel" title="Circassians in Israel">Circassians</a>, <a href="/wiki/Maronites_in_Israel" title="Maronites in Israel">Maronites</a> and <a href="/wiki/Samaritans" title="Samaritans">Samaritans</a>. Israel also hosts a significant population of non-citizen foreign workers and asylum seekers from Africa and Asia,<sup id="cite_ref-Adriana_Kemp_30-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Adriana_Kemp-30">[28]</a></sup> including <a href="/wiki/Illegal_immigration_from_Africa_to_Israel" title="Illegal immigration from Africa to Israel">illegal migrants from Sudan, Eritrea</a> and other <a href="/wiki/Sub-Saharan_Africa" title="Sub-Saharan Africa">Sub-Saharan Africans</a>.</p>
<p>In its <a href="/wiki/Basic_Laws_of_Israel" title="Basic Laws of Israel">Basic Laws</a>, Israel defines itself as a <a href="/wiki/Jewish_and_democratic_state" title="Jewish and democratic state">Jewish and democratic state</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-freedomhouse2008_31-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-freedomhouse2008-31">[29]</a></sup> Israel is a <a href="/wiki/Representative_democracy" title="Representative democracy">representative democracy</a><sup id="cite_ref-Norton2001_32-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Norton2001-32">[30]</a></sup> with a <a href="/wiki/Parliamentary_system" title="Parliamentary system">parliamentary system</a>, <a href="/wiki/Proportional_representation" title="Proportional representation">proportional representation</a> and <a href="/wiki/Universal_suffrage" title="Universal suffrage">universal suffrage</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-33" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-33">[31]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-34" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-34">[32]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Israel" title="Prime Minister of Israel">prime minister</a> is head of <a href="/wiki/Cabinet_of_Israel" title="Cabinet of Israel">government</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Knesset" title="Knesset">Knesset</a> is the <a href="/wiki/Legislature" title="Legislature">legislature</a>. Israel is a <a href="/wiki/Developed_country" title="Developed country">developed country</a> and an <a href="/wiki/Organisation_for_Economic_Co-operation_and_Development" title="Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development">OECD</a> member,<sup id="cite_ref-OECD_35-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OECD-35">[33]</a></sup> with the <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(nominal)" title="List of countries by GDP (nominal)">35th-largest</a> <a href="/wiki/Economy_of_Israel" title="Economy of Israel">economy</a> in the world by nominal gross domestic product as of 2016<sup class="plainlinks noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="//en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Israel&amp;action=edit">[update]</a></sup>. The country benefits from a highly skilled workforce and is among the most educated countries in the world with the <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_tertiary_education_attainment" title="List of countries by tertiary education attainment">one of the highest percentage</a> of its citizens holding a <a href="/wiki/Tertiary_education" title="Tertiary education">tertiary education</a> degree.<sup id="cite_ref-OECD_education_36-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-OECD_education-36">[34]</a></sup> The country has <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_Human_Development_Index#Middle_East_and_North_Africa" title="List of countries by Human Development Index">the highest</a> <a href="/wiki/Standard_of_living_in_Israel" title="Standard of living in Israel">standard of living</a> in the Middle East and the <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_Human_Development_Index#Asia" title="List of countries by Human Development Index">third highest</a> in Asia,<sup id="cite_ref-HDI_7-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-HDI-7">[7]</a></sup> and has <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_life_expectancy" title="List of countries by life expectancy">one of the highest life expectancies</a> in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-37" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-37">[35]</a></sup></p>
<p></p>
